{"step_by_step_thinking": "Root resorption refers to the process of root structure being broken down and resorbed by the body. It can occur as a normal part of tooth development or as a result of trauma or disease. In the context of the question, we are looking for the age at which root resorption starts as a normal part of tooth development. Typically, root resorption starts when the permanent teeth begin to erupt and replace the primary (baby) teeth. This process usually begins around the age of 6 years. Therefore, the most appropriate answer choice would be C. 6.5 years.", "answer_choice": "C"}
